title: gold elo is far worse than any other elo.
body:
riot needs to put intentional feed on top of all their ban holy shit. 

riot also needs to put something in place that when you shadow the champ you want to play your own team can not ban it.

replies.body:
Imagine _exactly_ what you've just said, except _without_ getting a free limited skin at the end of each year. Welcome to bronze/silver.

Tell me again how gold is so terrible?

if you're in that elo you know what you're getting you can't actually expect much from them. 

gold players have this ego that they don't need a win because they're already getting the god dam skin and they think its ok to ban out your champ play something stupid that doesn't suit your team comp when you're in an elo where it will be punished.

I mean, I think pretty much everyone thinks whatever elo they're stuck in is the worst for a lot of the same reasons and some that differ. 

Toxic players stuck in Bronze think it's the worst cause everyone's inconsistent and easily frustrated, Silver is much the same. 

Toxic Gold players suddenly seem to think they're the shiz and thus "Bronzie" gets thrown around a lot. 

Plat is where the skill gap really becomes somewhat significant so the toxic egos get ratcheted up even higher.

Diamond is where toxic people queue snipe each other as revenge for going 1/10 that one time.

Master and Challenger is all the same toxic people versing all the same other toxic people and therefore has all the problems of every other tier combined.

All generalisations of course. Majority of players I see are either perfectly lovely or don't say much at all, but different ranks seem to encourage different outlets for those prone to toxicity. Every elo has it's issues, and every elo is prone to some of the same kind of toxicity (It's like some people don't understand that you can't win every game, and if you're where you belong you're only going to be winning about half).

I don't think there's really any argument that any elo is better or worse, they're just all somewhat different. Plateauing in x elo just means you see more of the behaviour specific to that elo so it stands out more.
